details.title: India: Road to Final
details.content:
India vs Hong Kong, 4th Match, Group A, India won by 26 runs

India vs Pakistan, 5th Match, Group A: India won by 8 wickets

India vs Bangladesh, Super Four, Match 1: India won by 7 wickets

India vs Pakistan, Super Four, Match 3: India won by 9 wickets

India vs Afghanistan, Super Four, Match 5, Match tied

details.title: Bangladesh: Road to the Final
details.content:
Bangladesh vs Sri Lanka, 1st Match, Group B: Bangladesh won by 137 runs

 
Bangladesh vs Afghanistan, 6th Match, Group B: Afghanistan won by 136 runs
 
Bangladesh vs India, Super Four, Match 1: India won by 7 wickets
 
Afghanistan vs Bangladesh, Super Four, Match 4: Bangladesh won by 3 runs
 
Pakistan vs Bangladesh, Super Four, Match 6: Bangladesh won by 37 runs

It's Match Day and the #MenInBlue are all set to take on the @BCBtigers in the Final of #AsiaCup2018.

🇮🇳 vs 🇧🇩 Who are you backing to lift the today?

Live action starts at 5 PM IST. Follow the game here - https://t.co/lXRUQlZhXu pic.twitter.com/6gCRPbBkky

— BCCI (@BCCI) September 28, 2018

Bangladesh have done well to come so far in the tournament with their injury issues but they will be the first to admit that India start clear favourites.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) September 28, 2018

details.title: From the Driver's seat
details.content:
From the Driver's seat : #TeamIndia depart for the grand finale of #AsiaCup against 🇧🇩 #INDvBAN pic.twitter.com/YV2usS6ICH

— BCCI (@BCCI) September 28, 2018
Asia Cup final 2018: Key player battles to watch out for

details.title: Bangladesh: Road to the Final
details.content:
Bangladesh vs Sri Lanka, 1st Match, Group B: Bangladesh won by 137 runs

Bangladesh vs Afghanistan, 6th Match, Group B: Afghanistan won by 136 runs

Bangladesh vs India, Super Four, Match 1: India won by 7 wickets

Afghanistan vs Bangladesh, Super Four, Match 4: Bangladesh won by 3 runs

Pakistan vs Bangladesh, Super Four, Match 6: Bangladesh won by 37 runs

details.title: India win toss, opt to bowl
details.content: Indian skipper Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against Bangladesh.

Captain @ImRo45 wins the toss and elects to bowl first in the #AsiaCup 2018 Final.#INDvBAN pic.twitter.com/GRGoZksCzC

— BCCI (@BCCI) September 28, 2018

Here's our Playing XI for the match.#INDvBAN pic.twitter.com/fJvE2OT3ch

— BCCI (@BCCI) September 28, 2018

details.title: Bhuvneshwar Kumar starts proceeding
details.content: 3 runs off the first over

details.title: First Boundary!
details.content: Mehidy Hasan hits the first boundary of the innings
5 runs off the second over.
13 without loss after three overs.

India has made it quite clear that KL Rahul WILL NOT be considered for a role in the middle order. #IndvBan #AsiaCup @StarSportsIndia

— Aakash Chopra (@cricketaakash) September 28, 2018

details.title: Expensive over!
details.content: 12 runs off Bumrah's second over. Two boundaries and a wide.

details.title: Pulled for four
details.content: Liton Das gets on top off the delivery from Bhuvneshwar Kumar and pulls it for four.

details.title: 8 off the over
details.content: Bangladesh 33/0 after 5 over. Liton Das leading the charge for the Bangla Tigers.

details.title: Chahal comes into attack
details.content: India introduce spin in the sixth over with Yuzvendra Chahal coming into the attack.

details.title: 3 off the sixth over
details.content: Three runs scored off Chahal's first over. Bangladesh 36/0 after six overs.

details.title: Change of Ends for Bumrah
details.content: Jasprit Bumrah comes back into the attack to bowl the seventh over.

details.title: 42/0 after seven overs
details.content: Bangladeshoff to a steady start reaching a score of 42 without loss after seven overs.

details.title: First Six!
details.content: Liton Das dispatches a flat delivery from Chahal for the first six of the innings.

details.title: Another Six!
details.content: Liton Das picks up another deliver and clears the long-on boundary for a six.

details.title: Tidy over
details.content: One run off the tenth over by Bhuvneshwar

details.title: Kuldeep Yadav comes into attack
details.content: Kuldeep Yadav replaces Bumrah.
66/0 after 11 overs

details.title: Fifty for Liton!
details.content: Fifty up for Liton Das. That's his maiden ODI fifty.

details.title: Dropped by Chahal!
details.content: Liton Das is dropped by Chahal off Jadeja.

details.title: Steady start by Bangladeshi openers
Joint-fastest fifty
details.content: Liton Das's 33 ball fifty is the joint fastest fifty for Bangladesh against India. Tamim Iqbal has also scored a 33 ball fifty at Dhaka in 2010.

details.title: Century-Stand!
details.content: 100 runs partnership for the first wicket. Bangladesh off to a flying start.

details.title: Bangladesh: 102/0 after 18 overs
details.content: Bangladesh reach 102 in 18 overs with Liton Das at Liton Das batting on 73 and Mehidy Hasan batting on 27.

Wicket Time #AsiaCup #Final

— Aakash Chopra (@cricketaakash) September 28, 2018

details.title: Swept!  4,4
details.content: Liton Das sweeps two consecutive deliveries from Jadeja for brilliant boundaries.

details.title: First Wicket!
details.content: Mehidy Hasan is the first wicket to fall. Kedar Jadhav gets his man; breaks the partnership. Caught by Rayudu near cover-point.

Final. 20.5: WICKET! M Hasan (32) is out, c Ambati Rayudu b Kedar Jadhav, 120/1 https://t.co/lXRUQlHH5W #IndvBan #AsiaCup

— BCCI (@BCCI) September 28, 2018

details.title: Chahal strikes!
details.content: Bangladesh lose their second wicket. Yuzvendra Chahal traps Imrul Kayes lbw to leave Bangladesh at 128/2.

details.title: Mushfiqur Rahim walks out
details.content: Mushfiqur Rahim joins Liton Das at the crease.

details.title: Three down!
details.content: Kedar Jadhav picks up his second wicket. Mushfiqur Rahim is caught by Bumrah in the deep.

details.title: Jadeja Brilliance!
details.content: Mohammad Mithun is run-out by brilliant piece of fielding by Ravindra Jadeja.

details.title: Bangladesh 129/4 after 28 overs
details.content: Bangladesh are reduced to 139/4 after two wickets by Kedar Jadhav, one by Chahal and a brilliant Jadeja run-out. Mahmudullah comes out to bat.

details.title: Century for Liton Das!
details.content: Liton Das reaches his first ODI century.

details.title: Wicket no. 5
details.content: Kuldeep Yadav gets his first scalp. Mahmudullah is caught by Bumrah in the deep.

@anilkumble1074 calls it spot on - @BCCI @teamindia dry up the runs, and the wickets start to tumble

— Jonty Rhodes (@JontyRhodes8) September 28, 2018

details.title: Cheerful fans!
details.content: Indian and Bangladeshi supporters cheer for their respective teams.

details.title: Dhoni misses the run-out chance
details.content: India miss a run-out chance as Dhoni takes off the bails without the ball in his gloves.

details.title: Six!
details.content: Soumya Sarkar hits a much needed six for Bangladesh.
Bangladesh's Liton Das raises his bat and helmet to celebrate scoring a century. (Photo | AP)

details.title: Into the last 10
details.content: Bangladesh 178/5 after 40 overs. Liton Das batting on 111 and Soumya Sarkar on 18.

details.title: Stumped!
details.content: Liton Das is beaten by a Kuldeep Yadav googly and Dhoni doesn't miss the stumping chance. Third umpire takes some time to make the decision and it is OUT!

details.title: Mashrafe Stumped!
details.content: Mashrafe Mortaza is stumped by Mahendra Singh Dhoni off Kuldeep Yadav.

details.title: Dhoni's brilliance!
details.content: India's wicketkeeper Mahendra Singh Dhoni, left, stumps out Bangladesh's Liton Das. (Photo | AP)

details.title: 200 up for Bangladesh
details.content: End of 45 overs: Bangladesh 202/7

Last 25 overs, Bangladesh have made 81-7!!

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) September 28, 2018

details.title: Run-out!
details.content: Nazmul Islam is run-out. Bangladesh 213/8 in 46.4 overs.

Well begun is half the job done....Only half the job, Bangladesh #IndvBan #AsiaCup

— Aakash Chopra (@cricketaakash) September 28, 2018

details.title: Another run-out!
details.content: Brilliant piece of work in the field by India. Soumya Sarkar is run-out. MS Dhoni on fire.

details.title: All-out!
details.content: Bumrah wraps up the innings with a brilliant yorker. Rubel Hossain is out. Bangladesh: 222/10.

details.title: India to chase 223
details.content: Bangladesh are all out for 222/10. Kuldeep Yadav was pick of the bowlers grabbing three wickets for 45 runs. Liton Das starred for Bangladesh with a well-crafted 121.

details.title: India begin chase
details.content: Rohit and Dhawan are at the crease as they hope to chase the target of 223 set by Bangladesh.

details.title: Steady start for India
details.content: Indian openers start well scoring 12 runs in 2 overs.

details.title: Rohit slams six
details.content: Rohit sends a Nazmul Islam ball over the long on boundary line for a perfect six. The Indian openers seem to be in good touch finding the boundary line at regular intervals

details.title: Dhawan caught out
details.content: Shikhar Dhawan who was in good touch gifts his wicket to Nazmul Islam as Soumya Sarkar completes the catch. India are now at 35/1 at 4.4 overs.

details.title: Rayudu next man in
details.content: Ambati Rayudu now enters the game as he joins Rohit Sharma at the centre of the action.

details.title: Rayudu out
details.content: Ambati Rayudu edges a Mortaza ball to Rahim. India now 46/2 at 7.3 overs

details.title: Dinesh Karthik is the next man in
details.content: Dinesh Karthik steps into the crease after the fall of Ambati Rayudu. India now need 177 runs with 8 wickets remaining to win the Asia Cup.

details.title: Ambati Rayudu leaves the field
details.content: India's Ambati Rayudu, right, leaves the field after being dismissed by Bangladesh's captain Mashrafe Mortaza

details.title: India 57/2 after 10 overs
details.content: The men in Blue need 166 runs in 40 overs to reign supreme over the Asian continent. The first ten overs saw some free flowing boundaries from the blades of Shikhar Dhawan and Rohit Sharma before Bangladesh put the brakes with two quick wickets.

details.title: India 79/2 after 15 overs
details.content: Captain Rohit Sharma and Dinesh Kartik build a steady partnership of 33 of 45 balls as the experienced duo play out crucial overs without any casualty. Rohit seems in good touch scoring 47(50) with 3 sixes and 3 boundaries.

details.title: Captain Rohit falls
details.content: Rohit Sharma loses his wicket 2 runs short of a half century. The right hander pulls a Rubel Hossain ball right into the hands of Nazmul  Islam. India lose their third wicket with the scorecard reading 83/3 at 16.4 overs.

details.title: Dhoni walks in
details.content: Mahendra Singh Dhoni walks to the crease to join Dinesh Kartik. This is not a new premise to the batsman who has seen India through such pressure situations several times. Will Dhoni weave his magic again as India needs 140 runs in 33 overs to win.

details.title: India 90/3 after 20 overs
details.content: After the fall of Indian captain Rohit Sharma now the onus is on the experienced Mahendra Singh Dhoni and Dinesh Kartik to see that the pressure doesn't get the better of the men in blue. India need 133 runs in 30 overs with 7 wickets in hand.

details.title: DK's six
details.content: A much needed hit over the boundary line for the Indian side. Dinesh Kartik sends the fourth delivery of the 21st over packing over the wide long-on boundary line.

details.title: India crosses 100
details.content: Dhoni scores a boundary of the first delivery off the 24th over as India cross the three figure mark of 100

details.title: IND 112/3 after 25 overs
details.content: Dhoni and Kartik seem to be building a solid partnership as the duo are slowly taking the game away from Bangladesh with some sensible batting.

details.title: DK LBW
details.content: A big wicket for Bangladesh as Dinesh Karthik falls after a well made 37 leaving the scoreboard 137/4 at 30.4 overs. The right handed batsman misses the ball which hits him on the boot and up goes the umpire's finger.

details.title: Kedar Jadhav joins Dhoni
details.content: The right-handed Kedar Jadhav joins MS Dhoni at the centre. India now needs 84 runs in 19 overs with 6 wickets in hand. This is a crucial phase of the game which is now evenly poised and the team which is able to perform under the pressure will end up victors.

details.title: 150 for India
details.content: India crosses the 150-run mark in the 34th over with MS Dhoni and Kedar Jadhav out at the centre. The game is now interestingly setup as both teams have an equal chance of picking up a win from here. However, the indomitable presence of MS Dhoni at the centre will be a cause of concern for Bangladesh. The charismatic Dhoni has seen this pressure situation several times and will his experience of such situations count. Let's see.

details.title: Dhoni caught
details.content: Bangladesh get the big fish as Dhoni nicks a Mustafizur delivery to wicketkeeper Rahim leaving the scoreboard at 160/5 after 36.1 overs.

details.title: Ravindra Jadeja walks in
details.content: Ravindra Jadeja who has had a decent outing in the Asia cup this year walks out to join Kedhar Jadhav. Bangladesh now see a bright chance of ending on the victory podium with half the Indian batsmen back at the pavillion.

details.title: Kedar Jadhav retires hurt
details.content: Kedar Jadhav walks back to the pavillion after the team physio instructs him to return. The hard-hitting Jadhav had hurt his hamstring while going for a run in the 35th over

details.title: New man in Bhuvaneshwar Kumar
details.content: Bhuvaneshwar Kumar walks out to join Ravindra Jadeja at the centre. At the end of 39 overs India are short of the target by 54 runs with five wickets in hand.

details.title: Welcome boundary for India
details.content: Jadeja hits a straight drive to the boundary line. A welcome boundary for India after three overs as it will ease the pressure of the Men in Blue. 38 needed of 50 balls.

details.title: 26 needed of 30 balls
details.content: Some sensible batting by Jadeja and Bhuvaneshwar Kumar is slowly taking the game away from Bangladesh. The Tigers are again falling victims to pressure as they leak runs. India needs 26 of 30 balls with five wickets in hand

details.title: Bhuvi hits a six
details.content: Indian fans celebrate as Bhuvaneshwar Kumar heaves one past the boundary line. India now needs 20 of 27 balls to lift the Asia cup.

details.title: Bhuvi scores a boundary
details.content: Bhuvaneshwar Kumar might have been wicketless with the ball but is sure making up with some really good batting at the death. India now needs 13 runs in 18 balls.

details.title: Jadeja out
details.content: Ravindra Jadeja nicks a Rubel Hossain ball to wicketkeeper Rahim. Is this the turnaround Bangladesh needs. India needs 11 runs of 16 balls

details.title: Kedar Jadhav walks in
details.content: Jadhav who earlier left the crease due to a hamstring pull walks back at a critical juncture. Can the hard hitter finish the game for India

details.title: 9 runs needed of 12 balls
details.content: It's a tense game as India need 9 runs in the last two overs for a win. Can Bangladesh bowlers pull off a miracle or will India win another pressure game

details.title: Bhuvaneshwar caught out
details.content: A big wicket for Bangladesh as Bhuvneshwar is caught behind the stumps by Rahim off a Mustafizur delivery. The tension justs builds up with every ball now. India needs 9 runs of 11 balls

details.title: Kuldeep Yadav walks out
details.content: Kuldeep Yadav joins Kedhar Jadhav at the crease. The Men in Blue now can just hope that Kedhar can pull off a win. However, Bangladesh is not going without a fight. It's on

details.title: 6 runs needed of 6 balls
details.content: Jadhav picks up two runs of the last delivery of the 49th over. India now needs 6 runs in the final over with Kuldeep Yadav taking strike and Jadhav at the runner's end.

details.title: Mahmudullah to bowl last over
details.content: Mahmudullah will be Bangladesh's hope as he tries to defend 6 runs in the final over.

details.title: 4 runs of 4 balls
details.content: Two singles of two balls leaves the equation at 4 runs of 4 balls

details.title: Kuldeep lofts the ball for two runs
details.content: Kuldeep lofts the ball as crowds cheer. But the fielder cuts the boundary as India pick two important runs. Its now two needed of three balls

details.title: Wow. A dot ball
details.content: A dot ball under pressure. Now its 2 needed of 2 balls

details.title: India picks a single. The match is tied
details.content: Kuldeep picks a single to bring Jadhav on strike. The scores are now tied with one run needed of one ball.

details.title: India win by 3 wickets
details.content: India picks up the winning run courtesy leg byes and lift up the Asia Cup for a seventh time.

details.title: Seventh Asia Cup win for India
details.content: Pressure got the better of Bangladesh as India held on to their nerves to beat Bangladesh by three wickets to lift the Asia Cup. It was a close match between the neighbouring countries and the Indian team which dominated the series ends up on top.
